intro: Cutandia scleropoides, commonly known as the hard-stemmed cutandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Cutandia scleropoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
